plants.name: Lilium candidum
plants.description: A tall, striking perennial lily with large, fragrant white flowers resembling trumpets. It is often cultivated in gardens for its elegant blooms and is native to the Mediterranean region.
plants.funFact: Madonna Lily flowers have been symbolic in various cultures, often associated with purity and the Virgin Mary.

plants.name: Rhododendron ferrugineum
plants.description: A hardy evergreen shrub found in alpine regions, producing clusters of bright pink to red bell-shaped flowers. It thrives in acidic soils and is commonly found in the European Alps.
plants.funFact: The Alpenrose contains toxic compounds and was traditionally used in small doses for medicinal purposes.

plants.name: Nelumbo nucifera
plants.description: A large aquatic plant with distinctive round leaves and showy flowers that bloom above the water surface. It is revered in many Asian cultures and features pink or white blossoms.
plants.location: Asia, cultivated in water gardens worldwide
plants.funFact: Sacred Lotus seeds have been known to remain viable for over 1,000 years, making them one of the longest-living seeds on record.

plants.name: Erythronium americanum
plants.description: A woodland wildflower with drooping yellow flowers and mottled leaves resembling trout patterns. It is native to eastern North America and blooms early to mid-summer in some areas.
plants.funFact: The mottled leaves are thought to camouflage the plant among fallen leaves, protecting it from herbivores.
